verses.text: 聖靈使人脫離罪的律得自由所以現在，那些在耶穌基督裡的人就不被定罪了；

words.note: Lit. 'sacred spirit'.
Often refers to divine law or a principle.
Lit. 'determine guilt'.

verses.text: 因為生命之靈的律在基督耶穌裡使我自由，脫離了罪和死的律。

words.note: More formal/literary equivalent of 'de'.

verses.text: 律法是因肉體而軟弱無力，所作不到的， 神作到了：他差遣自己的兒子成為罪身的樣式，為了除掉罪，就在肉體中把罪判決了，

words.note: Often refers to the Mosaic Law.
In biblical context, often human nature apart from God.
Forms a nominalized phrase with the verb that follows.
Often refers to the Christian God.

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of

verses.text: 使律法所要求的義，可以在我們這些不隨從肉體而隨從聖靈去行的人身上實現出來。

words.note: Indicates direction or purpose of action.
In biblical context, 'walk' often means 'live' or 'conduct oneself'.
Indicates emergence or completion of an action.

verses.text: 隨從肉體的人，以肉體的事為念；隨從聖靈的人，以聖靈的事為念。

words.definition: set mind on, be concerned with
words.note: Lit. 'take as thought/concern'.

words.definition: set mind on, be concerned with

verses.text: 以肉體為念就是死，以聖靈為念就是生命、平安；

words.note: Refers to the human nature apart from divine influence.
In this context, 'to set one's mind on' or 'the mind of'.
In this context, 'to set one's mind on' or 'the mind of'.

verses.text: 因為以肉體為念就是與 神為仇，既不服從 神的律法，也的確不能夠服從；

words.note: Refers to the human nature apart from divine influence.
In this context, 'to set one's mind on' or 'the mind of'.

verses.text: 屬肉體的人不能得 神的喜悅。

words.note: Refers to the human nature apart from divine influence.

verses.text: 神的靈既然住在你們裡面，你們就不是屬於肉體，而是屬於聖靈的了。如果人沒有基督的靈，就不是屬於基督的。

words.note: Refers to the human nature apart from divine influence.

verses.text: 基督若在你們裡面，你們的身體因著罪的緣故是死的，而聖靈卻因著義的緣故賜給你們生命。
如果那使耶穌從死人中復活者的靈住在你們裡面，那使基督從死人中復活的，也必藉著住在你們裡面的聖靈，使你們必死的身體活過來。

words.note: Used as a suffix to denote 'among' or 'in'.
Lit. 'recover life'.
Suffix indicating a person or thing with a certain quality/action.
Used as a suffix to denote 'among' or 'in'.
Lit. 'recover life'.

verses.text: 與基督同作 神的後嗣弟兄們，可見我們並不是欠肉體的債，隨著肉體而活。
如果隨著肉體而活，你們必定死；如果靠著聖靈治死身體的惡行，你們就必活著。

words.note: Verb-complement structure meaning 'to cause to die by governing/treating'.

verses.text: 因為蒙 神的靈引導的，都是 神的兒子。

words.note: Often used in formal or biblical contexts for receiving grace or favor.
Turns the preceding phrase into a nominalized subject.

verses.text: 你們接受的，不是奴僕的靈，使你們仍舊懼怕；你們接受的，是使人成為嗣子的靈，使我們呼叫「阿爸、父」。

words.note: Aramaic word for 'father', expressing intimacy and affection.

verses.text: 聖靈親自和我們的靈一同證明我們是 神的兒女。

words.note: Refers to the Holy Spirit of God.
Refers to the human spirit.
The leading space `　` is an honorific formatting convention.

verses.text: 既然是兒女，就是後嗣；是 神的後嗣，也和基督一同作後嗣。我們既然和他一同受苦，就必和他一同得榮耀。
耐心期待將來的榮耀我看現在的苦難，與將要向我們顯出的榮耀，是無法相比的。

words.note: More formal than 和 (hé).

verses.text: 被造的萬物都熱切渴望 神的眾子顯現出來。

words.note: Often refers to creation in a religious context.
Refers to all creation, often in a biblical sense.
Refers to the 'sons of God'.
Directional complement, indicating emergence.

verses.text: 因為被造的萬物服在虛空之下，不是自己願意這樣，而是由於使它屈服的那一位；

words.note: A key concept in Ecclesiastes.
Nominalizes the preceding verb phrase.

verses.text: 被造的萬物盼望自己得著釋放，脫離敗壞的奴役，得著 神兒女榮耀的自由。

words.note: Describes something that has been made or brought into existence by a creator.
Refers to the entire created universe or all living creatures.
Often refers to moral decay or physical deterioration in biblical contexts.
Often refers to divine majesty or splendor in Christian contexts.

verses.text: 我們知道被造的萬物直到現在都一同在痛苦呻吟。
不但這樣，連我們這些有聖靈作為初熟果子的人，自己也在內心歎息，熱切期待成為嗣子，就是我們的身體得贖。

words.note: A divine person of the Trinity in Christianity.
Refers to the first produce of a harvest; metaphor for an initial installment or promise.

words.definition: to expect, to look forward to

words.note: In theological context, refers to being adopted as God's child.
Refers to being bought back or set free, often spiritually.

verses.text: 我們得救時就存著這盼望；但是看得見的盼望不是盼望，因為誰會盼望自己看見了的呢？

words.note: Refers to spiritual salvation from sin and death.
Often suffixed to a verb or phrase to mean 'when (that happens)'.

verses.text: 但如果我們盼望沒有看見的，就會耐心地熱切期待。

words.definition: to expect, to look forward to

verses.text: 照樣，聖靈也在我們的軟弱上幫助我們。原來我們不曉得應當怎樣禱告，但聖靈親自用不可言喻的歎息，替我們祈求。

words.note: Used as a postposition to indicate an aspect or area.
V-O compound: 'to pray a prayer'.
Lit. 'cannot be expressed in words'.
Used for earnest prayer or intercession.

verses.text: 那鑒察人心的，曉得聖靈的心意，因為聖靈照著 神的旨意替聖徒祈求。

words.note: Forms 'the one who...'
The preceding space is a reverential typesetting convention.
Often refers to God's will or imperial edicts.

verses.text: 我們知道，為了愛 神的人，就是按他旨意蒙召的人的益處，萬事都一同效力。

words.note: The preceding space is a reverential typesetting convention.
Forms 'one who...'
V-O compound: 'receive a call'.
Forms 'one who...'
Lit. 'exert power'.

verses.text: 因為 神預先知道的人，他就預先命定他們和他兒子的形象一模一樣，使他的兒子在許多弟兄中作長子，

words.note: The preceding space is a reverential typesetting convention.
Forms 'one who...'
Refers to divine predestination or decree.
Idiom: 'one mold, one appearance'.
Used as a postposition to indicate 'amongst' or 'within'.
Lit. 'eldest son'.

verses.text: 他預先命定的人，又呼召他們；所召來的人，又稱他們為義；所稱為義的人，又使他們得榮耀。

words.note: Forms 'one who...'
Often refers to God's calling.
Forms a nominal phrase, often with passive implication.
Lit. 'summoned to come'.
Forms 'one who...'
Forms 'one who...'

verses.text: 靠主就得勝有餘既是這樣，我們對這一切還有甚麼話說呢？ 神若這樣為我們，誰能敵對我們呢？

words.note: A title for God or Jesus
Lit. 'obtain victory and have abundance'
Capitalized as a proper noun for God

verses.text: 他連自己的兒子都捨得，為我們眾人把他交出來，難道不也把萬有和他一同白白地賜給我們嗎？

words.definition: don't tell me that, is it possible
words.note: Used to express rhetorical questions
Lit. 'ten thousand existences'
Often means 'for free' or 'by grace' in religious context

verses.text: 誰能控告 神揀選的人呢？有 神稱我們為義了。

words.note: Capitalized as a proper noun for God
Implies a reason or counter-argument, 'it is the case that'
Capitalized as a proper noun for God

verses.text: 誰能定我們的罪呢？有基督耶穌死了，而且復活了，現今在 神的右邊，也替我們祈求。

words.note: Implies a reason or counter-argument, 'it is the case that'
Capitalized as a proper noun for God

verses.text: 誰能使我們與基督的愛隔絕呢？是患難嗎？是困苦嗎？是迫害嗎？是飢餓嗎？是赤身露體嗎？是危險嗎？是刀劍嗎？
正如經上所記：「為你的緣故，我們終日面對死亡，人看我們像待宰的羊。」

words.note: Ancient Chinese construction for passive voice or what is done.
Literally 'awaiting slaughter'.

verses.text: 但靠著愛我們的那一位，我們在這一切事上就得勝有餘了。

words.note: Refers to God or Christ in this context.
Idiom meaning to gain a complete and overwhelming victory.

verses.text: 因為我深信：無論是死、是生，是天使、是掌權的，是現在的事，是將來的事，是有能力的，

words.note: 掌權 is 'to hold power', '的' nominalizes it to 'those who hold power'.
Here, '的' forms a noun phrase meaning 'those who have power'.

verses.text: 是高天的、是深淵的，或是任何別的被造之物，都不能叫我們與 神的愛隔絕，這愛是在我們的主耶穌基督裡的。

words.note: Refers to heavenly realms or things in high places.
Here, '的' forms a noun phrase meaning 'things in the heights'.
Refers to the deep places or the abyss.
Here, '的' forms a noun phrase meaning 'things in the depths'.
Literally 'that which is created thing'.
The preceding space is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
Indicates location or attribute, 'that is in...'
